item.title: [PI] Quests don't save! I've actually made an attempt to fix it! :D
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

You probably didn’t add the tokens required to save a players progress in game. They’re located in the playerSave class.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Quests don't save! I've actually made an attempt to fix it! :D
item.dc:creator: @Level_120_Dungeoneer Level 120 Dungeoneering
item.description:
@Level_120_Dungeoneer wrote:

Well, my quests don’t save.

I’m using a blank PI.

I made a quest full with Quest Journals and Dailogue… When you accept the quest, it turns yellow, when you finish the quest (give him the items), it turns green. But when I log out, and log back in, the quest is red! When you click on the journal, it shows all the stuff crossed off and “QUEST COMPLETE” at the bottom.

I’ve made an attempt to fix it, by adding this:

   if (quest_1 == 0);
   
   c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cook's Assisstant", 7332);

   if (quest_1 == 1);

   c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);

   if (quest_1 == 2)
      
   c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook's Assisstant", 7332);
   }

There was no errors in the Eclipse window, so I ran it, and it still was red. So, I added this after every quest stage:

[code=java]c.getPA().sendFrame126(“Cook’s Assisstant”, 7332); //Quest Stage = 0

c.getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Cook’s Assisstant", 7332); //Quest Stage = 1

c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook’s Assisstant", 7332); //Quest stage = 2 FINISHED

[/code]

So I logged in after I did that, and it was still red, but when I clicked it, it turned green!

I checked the character files, it shows that it is complete:

quest_1 = 2

I figure that I can do something like this,

[code=java]case 14:
c.getPA().QuestReward(c, “Cook’s Assisstant”, 2, “300 cooking experience.”, “1 Quest Point.”, “”,"","","", 1949);
c.getItems().deleteItem2(1944, 1);
c.getItems().deleteItem2(1927, 1);
c.getItems().deleteItem2(1933, 1);
c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
c.questPoints += 2;
c.quest_1 = 2;
c.sendMessage(“Congratulations, you have completed Cook’s Assisstant quest.”);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Quest Points: " + c.questPoints, 640);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Cook’s Assisstant", 7332);
c.getPA().addSkillXP(300, c.playerCooking);
c.nextChat = 0;
break;

[/code]

I tried that with no avail. Anyway that I can fix this?

Read full topic
